pageContext.claim: “And we will ban deadly sanctuary cities, get 'em out of here, nobody wants them. The only ones want 'em are the politicians.”
pageContext.analysis: Our colleague Michelle Ye Hee Lee grappled with question back in 2017. She found, “It’s clear that public opinion on sanctuary policies varies based on how you ask the question, and what exactly you ask about such policies. Criminality is a major factor, so questions that involve ‘crime’ and ‘arrests’ may elicit stronger responses against sanctuary policies.” Americans’ attitudes are far more varied and complex on this issue than Trump’s claim. He should not necessarily think that such a large percentage of Americans support its restrictions on sanctuary cities. (A 2018 Gallup poll found Americans opinions to be largely split.)
